item.title: How to watch Pope Francis's funeral, and what to expect
item.description: Pope Francis's funeral begins in Vatican City at 4 a.m. ET on Saturday and will end with his burial in Rome. Here's what to know about the day's events — and how Francis is breaking with tradition.

item.title: Trump pushes Russia-Ukraine peace deal. And, NPR's glimpse inside liberated Khartoum

item.title: Damage from gut bacteria may play a role in the rise in colon cancer in young adults
item.description: Scientists have a new clue in the mystery of why younger people are getting more colon cancer. It may have to do with a toxin produced by a common gut microbe.

item.description: Researchers using data from the James Webb Space Telescope recently announced they had detected biosignature gases on planet K2-18b. A new analysis of the same data casts doubt on the earlier findings

item.title: Scientists say NOAA cuts by Trump undermine improvements in hurricane forecasts
